H0.text: Mutualism is the most cooperative relationship between species.

H1.text: Predation is the most cooperative relationship between species.

H2.text: Parasitism is the most cooperative relationship between species.

H3.text: Coexistence is the most cooperative relationship between species.

A4.text: Symbiosis has often driven the evolution of species; mutualism has enabled species for example to colonise new environments.

A5.text: Mutualism improves both organisms' competitive ability, enabling them to outperform members of the same species that lack the symbiont.
